org_name: Mosaic Life Care at St. Joseph

request_pathways.name: Mail to HIM office (105 Far West Drive, Suite 202, St. Joseph, MO 64506)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients must use a generic third-party release authorization form (Form #3014) and fill themselves in as the recipient, selecting 'Personal' as the purpose.

red_flags: Mandatory purpose selection ('must select one') is not required under HIPAA for patient self-access requests
Two conflicting versions of the same form (Form #3014) published simultaneously with no indication of which is current
bright_spots: 15-language assistance notice including uncommon languages (Pennsylvania Dutch, Trukese) reflecting local demographics
Granular 13-category record type selection gives patients meaningful control over scope
Multiple electronic submission channels (email, fax) reduce access barriers

findability.rationale: Level 4: Forms are easy to find within 2-3 clicks via the HIM page and discoverable through site search, but dual versions on different pages without version clarity prevent a top score.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: The PDF has a text layer but zero fillable fields, requiring print-and-handwrite; however, fax and email submission are available, making it usable digitally with workarounds.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with logical flow, granular record type options, and reasonable length (2 pages), but legal density in disclaimers and a confusing title ('Access Request to Another Agency') are minor clarity issues.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the form by listing themselves as the recipient and selecting 'Personal' as the purpose, but the form was designed entirely for third-party release with no dedicated self-access pathway, no Right of Access language, and no portal mention.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: No notarization or in-person requirement, proper revocation and non-conditioning language, but the mandatory purpose field exceeds HIPAA requirements for patient access, fees are vaguely disclosed, and Right of Access timelines/fee limits are not communicated.

overall.summary: Mosaic Life Care provides a findable but paper-oriented generic ROI form that a patient can use for self-access with workarounds, but the lack of a dedicated patient access pathway, non-fillable PDF, and compliance gaps limit the experience.
